FacilityName: E&B Natural Resources Management Corp-Gas Plant#10

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Support Activities for Oil and Gas Operations

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
E & B Natural Resources is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is reflected in a comprehensive accidental release prevention program. This program addresses the design, installation, operation, maintenance, and employee training associated with the process equipment at the facility. 



E&B Natural Resources is committed to conducting business lawfully, ethically and in a socially and environmentally responsible manner. E & B Natural Resources' safety and environmental policies are administered by the Production Superintendent with assistance from the Environmental/Regulatory Tech. The Production Superintendent conducts periodic inspections of the facility to ensure compliance.  The Plant Manager oversees the entire safety and environmental programs, including the PSM/RMP/CalARP Program with the assistance of the operators and engineering staff. 



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



The facility is located at 1848 Perkins Rd. in New Cuyama, California.  The facility is approximately 3 miles south of highway 166 and 10 miles west of highway 33. The area immediately surrounding the facility is rural.  The facility is currently under construction and is scheduled to begin operations in late 2019/early 2020.



The primary equipment in the "covered process" is as follows:



?    18,000 NGL/LPG Tank 

?    Associated NGL/LPG Piping



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The E & B Natural Resources ' NGL/LPG process has many safety features. Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system. For example, the facility operates in accordance with Cal/OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation. The facility conducts preventative maintenance and any necessary minor repairs in house, but an outside contractor is hired for major repairs or maintenance.



The facility, including the NGL/LPG Process, was designed and co

nstructed in accordance with the Uniform Mechanical Code applicable at the time of construction (November 2019), which specifically outlines requirements for the safe operation of the NGL/LPG system. 



In addition to the Uniform Mechanical Code, E & B Natural Resources  has developed a preventive maintenance program to complete regularly scheduled inspections and tests of NGL/LPG system as well as repairs as needed to process equipment.



The NGL/LPG system at the E & B Natural Resources facility is equipped with various system controls and status indicators intended to minimize potential NGL/LPG related accidents and to allow operators to monitor system operations. Level indicators are located on the NGL/LPG tank.  Pressure and temperature indicators are located throughout the process. The level, pressure, and temperature indicators allow operators to monitor system operations and to determine potential adverse situations in the event of deviations from standard or acceptable operating conditions. Regular system inspections also permit operators to monitor operations. 



Pressure relief valves are present on all vessels and on various sections of piping. These devices are designed to ensure high pressure conditions within the equipment do not transpire. The design ratings of these valves are dependent upon the operating pressure of the equipment. The relief valves ion the NGL/LPG vent to the atmosphere; all other pressure relief valves vent internally.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



The NGL/LPG process at E & B Natural Resources  is of new construction.  System start up is scheduled for December 2019/early 2020.  There have been no releases of NGL/LPG that meet the EPA criteria for the five year accident history.  In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from a NGL/LPG release, nor any releases or "near misses" that warranted an internal incident investigation.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The E & B Natural Resources  facility has an emergency a

ction plan in effect.  The Emergency Action Plan (Plan) is summarized in the Emergency Planning and Response section of this PSM/RMP/CalARP document. This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:



  1.)  To save lives.

  2.)  To minimize and avoid injuries.

  3.)  To protect the environment.

  4.)  To minimize property damage.



The operator of the facility maintains a safety committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, NGL/LPG health hazards, and mitigation procedures, which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility.  This Plan is reviewed and updated at least once per year. This Plan was reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM, RMP, and CalARP regulations.



In case of a NGL/LPG emergency, the facility plans to evacuate all employees and contractors and activate the facility's action plan to respond to the situation.  If necessary, they will alert the local emergency responders (fire department) for assistance. The facility plans to coordinate emergency response efforts with the fire department on a periodic and ongoing basis.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The Process Hazards Analysis, with the initial review performed on October 25, 2018, updated on January 24, 2019, and finalized on December 6, 2019 which included a Cause/Effect study and provided mitigation measures to improve safety at the E & B Natural Resources  facility.  The E & B Natural Resources  safety committee is planning to complete several items over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees.  These changes include the following items:



1. Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety Plan/Programs.



2. Continue to have employee involvement in Safety Plan Development.



3. Continue employee involvement throug

h safety team participation.



4. Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.







EXTERNAL EVENTS/SEISMIC SUMMARY



External events were considered during the Process Hazard Analysis, performed on October 25, 2018, updated January 24, 2019, and finalized on December 6, 2019 as any type of catastrophic failure (i.e. line break).  Catastrophic failures encompass the following external events: fire, high ambient temperature, and low ambient temperature. A catastrophic line failure of the NGL/LPG system could result in a line break which was examined in the Hazard Assessment.  



In accordance with the CalARP Program Seismic Assessment Guidance Document, a facility's Seismic Assessment must be reviewed and updated every five years.  An inspection of the NGL/LPG process equipment will be conducted by a Structural Engineer in early 2020.  Recommendations from the Seismic Assessment study are included in the Seismic Assessment Report.  All recommendations from the Seismic Assessment study will be completed by system startup.
